thread.title: Easton's Kevin Lapsansky runs to EPC individual cross country championship
thread.title_full: Easton's Kevin Lapsansky runs to EPC individual cross country championship

title: Easton's Kevin Lapsansky runs to EPC individual cross country championship
text:
Complete Box Score » 
Eastern Pennsylvania Conference boys cross country championship - Rapid Recap 
Easton senior Kevin Lapsansky won his first EPC individual cross country championship in 16 minutes and 9 seconds on the course at the Bethlehem Executive Municipal Golf Course Tuesday afternoon. 
The Rovers’ attempt to repeat as team champions was denied by Parkland, however, who took the team trophy with 42 points to Easton’s 51. 
Turning point: Parkland gobbled up the even-number top-10 finishes – 4th ( Daniel Kyvelos ), 6th ( Sam Morgan ), 8th ( Steven Kaleycik ) and 10th ( Mat Bianco ) – that allowed them to edge out the Red Rovers. 
Top performer: Lapsansky was really in a race by himself, winning over Pleasant Valley’s Seth Slavin by 13 seconds. 
What it means: The Trojans have demonstrated their depth and talent which makes them the favorite for a District 11 Class AAA championship next week. But Easton cannot be counted out. On the individual side, it seems clear Lapsansky will be the overwhelming favorite for gold. 
Brad Wilson may be reached at bwilson@lehighvalleylive.com . Follow him on Twitter @bradwsports . Find Lehigh Valley high school sports on Facebook .
